Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.15 towards the normal and a depth of 0.0 opposite the normal. **Part 2 - Cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom** Create a new coordinate system at 0.2397, 0.1784, 0.15 euler angles and translation vector. Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. Draw the following: 1. Circle 1 (loop 1): Center at 0.225, 0.225; Radius 0.225 2. Circle 1 (loop 2): Center at 0.225, 0.225; Radius 0.2025 Constrain the circles to have the same center point. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.45. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.48 towards the normal and a depth of 0.0 opposite the normal. **Part 3 - Cylindrical object with flat top and bottom, curved side, and rectangular opening on side** Create a new coordinate system at 0.2622, 0.2063, 0.15 euler angles and translation vector. Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. Draw the following: 1. Face 1: Line 1: Start Point at 0.1558, 0.0; End Point at 0.1558, 0.3941; Arc 1: Start Point at 0.1558, 0.3941; Mid Point at 0.0, 0.197; End Point at 0.1558, 0.0 2. Face 2: Line 1: Start Point at 0.2492, 0.0; End Point at 0.2492, 0.3941; Arc 1: Start Point at 0.2492, 0.3941; Mid Point at 0.405, 0.197; End Point at 0.2492, 0.0 Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.405. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.0 towards the normal and a depth of 0.375 opposite the normal.</description>
